sentence: International Business Machines Corp. ( IBM ) has announced that it's buying Salesforce.com, Inc. ( CRM ) partner Bluewolf.
The acquisition of Bluewolf will have it integrating with IBM Global Business Services' Interactive Experience.
The company didn't announce financial details of the deal, but did say that it will close during the second quarter of 2016 .
Bluewolf is a cloud consulting company that has remained a strong partner of Salesforce.com over the years.
IBM expects the acquisition of the company to help expand its own "analytics, experience design and industry consulting leadership."
Unnamed sources told Recode that IBM is paying roughly $200 million for Bluewolf.
